page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: TRANSPORT { The Guernsey transport network is meagre although efficient.Because of the sparse population the need for transport is limited.There are no trains on Guernsey because the island is not large enough to constitute a rail service,most people use a car,bus ,motorcycle or bicycle. There is however an airport which handles over one hundred planes per day and five thousand passengers.To help with this there are one thousand people employed in the running of the airport.The airport is a pleasant place with a duty free shop and an outdoor viewing gallery. Guernsey Airport handles only a few jets but mainly Fokker 27 or Dart Heralds also Islanders and Trislanders used by Aurigney Air Services.
